meanings.definition: Having the quality of permeating or spreading throughout
meanings.sent1: The permeative aroma of fresh bread filled the entire room.
meanings.sent2: The scent of flowers is permeative in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The permeative smell of popcorn made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a permeative effect on the whole community.
meanings.sent5: The music had a permeative quality that touched everyone's hearts.

meanings.definition: Capable of passing through or penetrating
meanings.sent1: The permeative nature of light allows it to shine through glass.
meanings.sent2: Water is a permeative substance that can seep through cracks.
meanings.sent3: His ideas were as permeative as water leaking through a sieve.
meanings.sent4: The truth has a permeative power that cannot be contained.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the sun felt permeative as it soaked into her skin.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the ability to diffuse or spread widely
meanings.sent1: The permeative fog covered the entire valley in a blanket of mist.
meanings.sent2: Gossip is a permeative force that spreads quickly through a community.
meanings.sent3: The laughter in the room was so permeative that even the grumpiest person smiled.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm was permeative, infecting everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The news of the victory was permeative, reaching every corner of the town.
